thread.title: The most epically New England outfits we spotted at the Head of the Charles - Fashion
thread.title_full: The most epically New England outfits we spotted at the Head of the Charles - Fashion

author: boston.com
title: The most epically New England outfits we spotted at the Head of the Charles - Fashion
text:
Previous -- of -- Next Kimberly Baker, 25, and Samantha Straus, 25, of Medford posed in Harvard Square before heading to Head of the Charles. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Preston Turk, 23, of Allston, sported a crewneck sweater with khakis, while Scarlett Ho, 22, a Northeastern student, accessorized a tweed jacket with an ascot. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Dave Girvan, 24, of Somerville sported L.L.Bean boots, plaid pants, and a matching sweater and vest. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Peter Evans, 10, Bennett Stout, 8, and Brandon Marconi, 9, all of Duxbury, rocked their Vineyard Vine half-zips. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next From left to right: Brent Ridge, 42, Lizzy Spalding, 26, and Josh Kilmer-Purcell, 46, from Sharon Springs, New York, all wore Beekman 1802 boots. Ridge and Kilmer-Purcell own the lifestyle brand. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Norman Johnson, 51, from the South End brought a bit of summertime to Cambridge in fall with teal bow-tie printed shorts. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Andrew Murray, 25, of Melbourne, Australia, kept it cool in neutrals. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Walker, 8, and Warner, 6, of New York partook in New England fashion. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Richard Green, 54, and Durelle Green, 54, from Easton, Connecticut matched in green vests. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Nick Smith, 19, and Terry Parkinson, 60, of Connecticut, were all about nature. Smith wore salmon pink pants, and Parkinson had on loafers with foxes printed on them. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Russell Lahti, 56, of Newton accessorized with a straw hat and fluffy dog. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Mary Katherine Johnson, 27, and Gaines Johnson, 29, of the South End brought a little bit of their Southern roots to their New England getups. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Mariah Waldman, 28, and David Waldman, 31, of the South End, were as fit for a horse race as they were for a boat race—she wore riding boots, he sported a three-piece suit. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Meghan Davis, 25, of Boston, tied together her nautical-chic look with leather accessories. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Gary Nilsen, 60, of Port Washington, New York, walked his sheepdogs along the river while wearing a sports coat and pinstripe shirt. Ashli Molina / Boston.com Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Sophia Clarke, 18, of Jamaica Plain, and Jack Sullivan, 18, of Brooklyn, Connecticut, bundled up for the occasion. Clarke wore a long wool coat; Sullivan layered a jacket over a shawl-collared sweater and plaid button-down. Ashli Molina / Boston.com
